update.description: Another pull request to integrate graph utilities into Ignition Math. In this pull request the `Graph` class is added.
update.title: Graphs part3

content.raw: If you don't pass an Id, it will invalid forever, otherwise will be valid. I have updated the doc in 38d83f7. I believe that we made the Id optional in the `Edge` constructor to make it consistent with the `Vertex` class. Now, I think that we should restore it as it was, and forget the `Valid()` method in the `Edge` class. I can make the change here or in the next pull request if it makes sense.
content.html: If you don't pass an Id, it will invalid forever, otherwise will be valid. I have updated the doc in 38d83f7. I believe that we made the Id optional in the Edge constructor to make it consistent with the Vertex class. Now, I think that we should restore it as it was, and forget the Valid() method in the Edge class. I can make the change here or in the next pull request if it makes sense.

update.description: Another pull request to integrate graph utilities into Ignition Math. In this pull request the `Graph` class is added.

content.raw: Sounds good.

content.raw: I'm fine with not having these setters, all I wonder is what's the use of the concept of a [Valid](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/8f6c553df8171e77d1479651e3d5a8818d702235/include/ignition/math/graph/Edge.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default#Edge.hh-180) edge if the id can never change? There is no way to "mark" an edge as invalid, the way the documentation suggests, right?
content.html: I'm fine with not having these setters, all I wonder is what's the use of the concept of a Valid edge if the id can never change? There is no way to "mark" an edge as invalid, the way the documentation suggests, right?

content.raw:
The first one is ambiguous because it's unclear if you want to store an `int` within the vertex or within the edge (unless we assume that the vertex has preference over the edge).

I'd like to tackle this one in a future pull request if you don't mind. I remember starting a branch for testing these ideas in the past and it wasn't trivial.
content.html:
The first one is ambiguous because it's unclear if you want to store an int within the vertex or within the edge (unless we assume that the vertex has preference over the edge).

I'd like to tackle this one in a future pull request if you don't mind. I remember starting a branch for testing these ideas in the past and it wasn't trivial.

content.html: And also to group a few classes that are related. One more class with graph algorithms will be merged shortly too.

content.raw:
Is there an easy way to instantiate graphs that do not want/need edge and/or vertex data?

For example, assume I only want to store `int` Veretex data in an UndirectedGraph. Then I'd like:

```
ignition::math::graph::UndirectedGraph<int> graph
```

or, if I only care about vertex names and edge weights:

```
ignition::math::graph::UndirectedGraph graph
```
content.html:
Is there an easy way to instantiate graphs that do not want/need edge and/or vertex data?

For example, assume I only want to store int Veretex data in an UndirectedGraph. Then I'd like:

ignition::math::graph::UndirectedGraph<int> graph

or, if I only care about vertex names and edge weights:

ignition::math::graph::UndirectedGraph graph

content.raw: Ahh thanks
content.html: Ahh thanks

content.raw: Works for me
content.html: Works for me

content.raw: It's so that it is clear that `Edge` and `Vertex` are graph concepts. They are not related to `math::Box` for example.
content.html: It's so that it is clear that Edge and Vertex are graph concepts. They are not related to math::Box for example.

content.raw: The std::move here performs a copy. I'm not sure if the intention was to take ownership of `_edge` in order to prevent a copy. If that was the intention, then `_edge` will need to be a `unique_ptr`.
